docs.lead_paragraph: When Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg began taking general questions at a news conference on Tuesday, the first topic was not his coming State of the City address, or teacher evaluation problems that are endangering federal education money, or even the New Hampshire primary. It was Beyonce Knowles and Jay-Z.
docs.abstract: Reporters press New York City Mayor Michael R Bloomberg about assertions that recording artists Beyonce Knowles and Jay-Z ad paid Lenox Hill Hospital in Manhattan more than $1 million to convert a hospital wing into a private suite, while having their security guards block other patients for hours; Bloomberg responds by defending the rights of private hospitals to rent out executive suites, citing the revenues that such rentals generate. (M)

headline.main: Should We Have National Standards for Sex Education?

docs.abstract: What should children know about sexuality - and when should they know it?
docs.snippet: What should children know about sexuality - and when should they know it?

docs.lead_paragraph: A group of advocates for sexuality education in schools, including the Sexuality Information and Education Council of the United States, Advocates for Youth and Answer, have joined forces and worked with "40 individuals from the fields of health education, sexuality education, public health, public policy, philanthropy and advocacy" to create what they call "national sexuality education standards (PDF)." The report says that the goal of the proposed standards is to "provide clear, consistent and straightforward guidance on the essential minimum, core content for sexuality education that is developmentally and age-appropriate for students in Grades K-12."

docs.lead_paragraph: Noncelebrity maternity patients said they experienced a series of indignities as Lenox Hill Hospital went all-out to protect the privacy of Beyoncé and Jay-Z.

headline.seo: After Beyoncé Gives Birth, Patients Protest Celebrity Security at Lenox Hill Hospital
headline.main: After Beyoncé Gives Birth, Patients Protest Celebrity Security at Lenox Hill Hospital
headline.print_headline: As R&B Royalty Gives Birth, Security Irks Hospital’s Other Patients

docs.abstract: Maternity patients and visitors say they experienced a series of indignities as Lenox Hill Hospital went to great lengths to protect the privacy of singers Beyonce Knowles and Jay-Z, whose daughter was born there on January 7.

docs.lead_paragraph: What would happen if patients were encouraged not only to review their medical records but to really own them? A research collaboration called OpenNotes has set out to answer this question.

headline.seo: A study encourages people to take the doctor’s notes home after exams.
headline.main: Project Puts Records in the Patients’ Hands
headline.print_headline: Project Puts Records in the Patients’ Hands

docs.abstract: Dr Tom Delbanco, principal investigator of study published in journal Annals of Internal Medicine, reports on OpenNotes, a research collaboration that looked at patient and physician attitudes and reactions to creating medical records that patients could take home, study and own; while some concerns remain, overall findings are that open medical records can help patients make good decisions concerning their health between visits.
docs.snippet: What would happen if patients were encouraged not only to review their medical records but to really own them? A research collaboration called OpenNotes has set out to answer this question.

docs.lead_paragraph: Two studies in The Journal of the American Medical Association provide new clues, but many questions remain.

headline.seo: Stillbirth Causes Are Tallied, but Risks Remain a Challenge
headline.main: New Clues Revealed in Studies of Stillbirth
headline.print_headline: New Clues Revealed In Studies Of Stillbirth

docs.abstract: Two studies published in The Journal of the American Medical Association identify the most common causes of stillbirth, which occurs at a higher rate in the United States than in many other developed countries; studies find that known risk factors explain only a minority of stillbirth cases and conclude that more research is needed, particularly concerning disparities among races and ethnicities.
docs.snippet: Two studies in The Journal of the American Medical Association provide new clues, but many questions remain.

keywords.value: Journal of the American Medical Assn
keywords.name: organizations

docs.lead_paragraph: The attacks on Rick Santorum and his wife are weird but inevitable.
docs.abstract: Ross Douthat Op-Ed column asserts that the criticism that Rick Santorum has received for bringing home the stillborn baby his wife delivered in 1996, so that his family could come to terms with their loss, was inevitable, given the way that the personal has become political; argues that by turning their personal choices to political ends, politicians lose the right to complain when those same personal lives are subject to partisan critiques.
docs.snippet: The attacks on Rick Santorum and his wife are weird but inevitable.
